title: Why did Will Bayley pull out of Strictly this week?
text:
Will Bayley and Janette Manrara had to sit out this week’s Strictly (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing was missing some notable people from its line-up as the Halloween special took to the airwaves on Saturday night.

While Neil Jones dropped out of the show at short notice – with Kevin Clifton stepping in at the last minute to partner Alex Scott – Will Bayley and Janette Manrara were also absent from the show, where they had been due to perform a jive after last weekend’s emotional couple’s choice routine.

So just where was the Paralympian – and will he be returning to the show?

Here’s what you need to know…

Why did Will Bayley pull out of Strictly this week?

The table tennis ace – who reduced judge Motsi Mabuse to tears last Saturday – dropped out of the show this week after suffering a nasty knee injury in rehearsals which left him unable to dance.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘You may have noticed Will and Janette are missing from tonight’s line up,’ said Claudia. ‘Unfortunately Will suffered a knee injury in training and although he was desperate to take part, after a full medical check he has been told he absolutely cannot perform and must rest.’

Will suffered a knee injury after leaping off a table during rehearsals for the jive (Picture: BBC)

Will took to Twitter to confirm the news also, saying he was ‘absolutely gutted’ that he was unable to perform.

‘He was so looking forward to being loud, fun, energetic, Will – and I think the jive was perfect for him,’ Janette said on the show.

‘Obviously he’s a bit gutted he couldn’t be with us tonight, but he’s home, he’s ice-ing, he’s taking care of himself and he’s resting.’

Is Will returning to Strictly Come Dancing next week?

Will said on social media he was hoping to be back in action next Saturday night, saying: ‘I hope to be back on the dance floor next week…thanks for all your messages guys, I’ll be back!!’

Tess Daly confirmed on the show that the couple had been given a pass through to next week under the circumstances, saying: ‘Under the rules of Strictly Come Dancing, at this stage of the competition, they have been given a bye through to next week’s show.’

It’s not been confirmed whether Will would have to bid farewell to the dancefloor for good if he were unable to dance next weekend.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Only one contestant – athlete Jade Johnson – has ever quit the show mid-series due to injury.

Jade, who was a contestant in 2009, pulled out of a live show at short notice after sustaining a ligament injury in dress rehearsals, and subsequently withdrew from the competition.

Made In Chelsea’s Jamie Laing pulled out of the series earlier this year after he was injured during the taping of the launch show – with Kelvin Fletcher stepping in as his replacement – but in his case he exited the series before the live shows had begun.

Strictly Come Dancing’s results show is on BBC One on Sunday night at 7.15pm. The series continues on BBC One next Saturday at 7pm.

description: Will Bayley MBE had to miss this weekend's Strictly Come Dancing - what happened?
